content.question: The regions bounded by the graphs of <math alttext="y equals 4 x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals, x minus x squared, plus x cubed" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>âˆ’</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> are shaded in the figure above. What is the sum of the areas of the shaded regions?

topic.text: 8.6: Finding the Area Between Curves That Intersect at More Than Two Points

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
